title: Alisha-k
author: Alisha-k
content: I read somewhere in this forum, I can't particularly place the section but the person said, there's no one in this century who hasn't heard about Bitcoin and who doesn't know the future it holds for us and I was of the opinion that that can't be true.Judging from my immediate family, I could tell my parents may know that there's something called Bitcoin and that's because myself and siblings hold random discussions about it.Going through my Facebook account yesterday, I also discovered a very funny trending hilarious video that support my notion.https://www.facebook.com/kobokocomedian/videos/1312697769656434/?app=fblðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: To be honest, I find their English hard to understand and I wouldn't really take seriously videos like this one because I think most of the time they just pay some money to say this or that in video. It's also curious that most of them time when people are asked with this question, no one asks back what is Bitcoin or what's the price of bitcoin or how can they exchange it, that's why I don't believe in the authenticity of these videos.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: And you forgot if nowadays staged videos are everywhere, what are you see on a video isn't actually real.There's a chance someone become dumb on purpose because they don't want to reveal themselves to know about Bitcoin or express themselves are Bitcoin holders.I believe there's someone still never heard of word Bitcoin especially they live in a country where the government is strict e.g. North Korea.

comments.author: pawel7777
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on June 19, 2023, 02:13:18 PMAnd you forgot if nowadays staged videos are everywhere, what are you see on a video isn't actually real.There's a chance someone become dumb on purpose because they don't want to reveal themselves to know about Bitcoin or express themselves are Bitcoin holders.I believe there's someone still never heard of word Bitcoin especially they live in a country where the government is strict e.g. North Korea.Yeah, most viral videos are probably staged, but I don't think this is the case with this one. When you live in a densely populated city, it's not hard to find a few people willing to be interviewed and then cherry-pick the funniest (or most stupid) answers. And it's probably cheaper too, as with staged videos, the "actors" would likely want to have their cut.As for Bitcoin's recognition, there are loads of people who are familiar with its name, but don't know pretty much anything else and are clueless about its value.

OP not everyone here is from your country and it is really hard to get the context of your video. Don't be lame like the host of the video you shared.

comments.body: Why is it considered funny that people don't know what Bitcoin is?I think it's only natural that there are people who don't understand or know what bitcoin is.In my country, there are still people who don't know what bitcoin is.bitcoin is famous among 2000 and above, not below, so don't laugh at people who don't know what bitcoin is because it's normal in my opinionsorry, I'm too sensitive about this video because in my opinion it's too mocking even though there's something he said that I don't understand, but from the look on his face, you can see a smile of ridicule whether it's real or a trick, but it's inappropriate

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Alisha-k on June 19, 2023, 01:12:46 PMI read somewhere in this forum, I can't particularly place the section but the person said, there's no one in this century who hasn't heard about Bitcoin and who doesn't know the future it holds for us and I was of the opinion that that can't be true.Judging from my immediate family, I could tell my parents may know that there's something called Bitcoin and that's because myself and siblings hold random discussions about it.Going through my Facebook account yesterday, I also discovered a very funny trending hilarious video that support my notion.https://www.facebook.com/kobokocomedian/videos/1312697769656434/?app=fblðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚There is no doubt that Bitcoin awareness is spreading rapidly in many countries especially developing nations. The citizens of the nations are seeking ways of avoiding inflation and the decline in the value of local currencies. Many people have been introduced to Bitcoin to help them fight this inflation and devaluation of the currency of their nation which will make their savings worthless in the future. I know Nigeria has one of the biggest bitcoin markets in Africa because many Nigerians especially the youths are embracing it. But bitcoin awareness is low among those between the ages of 50 and above. Many of them might have heard the word Bitcoin but I can attest that they know little or nothing about the currency. In the rural areas, many people have not even heard the word Bitcoin. As many members have said, most of the content on these social media space is staged to achieve an objective. But no doubt bitcoin awareness is increasing every day even among the elderly.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Not everyone in any part of the world even cares when you try to raise awareness about bitcoin, because everyone's financial critical level can be different in terms of several aspects such as personality, environment, economic condition, etc.Throughout my journey in this space, someone will really welcome the explanation of bitcoin when they really want a financial solution. At this point sometimes they are also more realistic, if you don't look rich then don't expect them to listen to you.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Alisha-k on June 19, 2023, 01:12:46 PMI read somewhere in this forum, I can't particularly place the section but the person said, there's no one in this century who hasn't heard about Bitcoin and who doesn't know the future it holds for us and I was of the opinion that that can't be true.Judging from my immediate family, I could tell my parents may know that there's something called Bitcoin and that's because myself and siblings hold random discussions about it.Going through my Facebook account yesterday, I also discovered a very funny trending hilarious video that support my notion.https://www.facebook.com/kobokocomedian/videos/1312697769656434/?app=fblðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚I have watched the video and it's just a guy asking random people about Bitcoin, and that's totally useless because the people seem technically weak ones and they don't even know how to withdraw money if they accept Bitcoin. They are from Nigeria and they know their currency very well and that's why they are choosing their own fiat currency over Bitcoin. I must say that their English is totally un-understandable, and most of the words just flow over my head. However, the guy was asking about Blockchain and people were saying something really strange because I think they considered blocks + chains and came with conclusion as blockchain which makes sense.After watching the video I found nothing special, but someone who was pranking with innocent people who weren't even aware about Bitcoin. It's understandable that the technology of Bitcoin is not as old or mature as of fiat based currencies and that's why most people don't know how to use it. In many small cities people are so weak in technology that they can't sell anything online because they don't know how to do bank-transfer or receive bank-transfer from the banks own application. Although, the banks are nowadays giving complete control to a user to transfer and receive the funds using their own applications but still users aren't that knowledgeable to take benefits from such services. So, it's not fair to prank with those people who aren't aware about a technology, the better way is to teach them about the technology they are lacking, and promote awareness about it so that they may get interest to learn about it. Teach them what's Bitcoin and how the blockchain and Bitcoin works, that would be a great thing for humanity rather than creating prank videos that show people's lack of knowledge regarding Bitcoin.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: I'll find this video educational if, at the end of the interview, he gives some mini book regarding bitcoins and some freebies to promote it; if it's that the case, then it will be worth sharing. But if it's just some survey proving how ignorant people are regarding bitcoins until now, then it's not that bad. At least we know how far bitcoins reach in this part of the world, and we see how they react when they first hear about it. I want to see the same interview in the next 5-10 years; I wonder if it's the same or if they are improving their Bitcoin knowledge.
